result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:19 PM Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adrian Avila in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather Lynn Richmond in court for Adrian Avila. Information received. Defendant waives formal reading and enters NOT GUILTY pleas to all counts. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.

1:12 PM Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adrian Avila in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather Lynn Richmond in court for Adrian Avila. Court makes stmt.  PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Court finds waiver to be freely and voluntarily made and accepts waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony was committed and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Court adjourns for Information to be filed.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
